oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Billy Sherrill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1981 Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Billy Sherrill. The recording takes place on 11-13-81.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Billy Sherrill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One, Tape 1 of 2 - (0:16) -- Bob Allen asks about Billy Sherrill's arrangement with his record label. (1:48) -- Billy Sherrill discusses how difficult it can be to sign an artist. (2:56) -- Bob Allen asks whether Billy Sherrill became tired of working with certain artists. (4:00) -- Billy Sherrill discusses working with Lacy J. Dalton. (4:17) -- Bob Allen mentions Billy's work with Tammy Wynette. (5:12) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his work with George Jones. (6:52) -- Billy Sherrill discusses his professional relationship with George Jones. (8:03) -- Billy Sherrill mentions his frustrations with George Jones. (10:35) -- Billy Sherrill mentions his friendly relationships with fellow Nashville producers. (11:58) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his work with Lacy J. Dalton. (13:25) -- Billy Sherrill describes finding a hit song. (14:00) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill how many artists he is currently producing for. (15:52) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his workflow with fewer artists. (16:42) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill what he looks for when searching for a hit record. (22:30) -- Billy Sherrill discusses working with David Allan Coe. (23:04) -- Bob Allen asks about a possible creative argument between Billy Sherrill and an artist. (27:05) -- Billy Sherrill discusses that he'd rather produce a hit record that he personally loved rather than a song he disliked. (27:45) -- Billy Sherrill mentions the Hank Williams Jr. song "All My Rowdy Friends (Have Settled Down)." (29:50) -- Billy Sherrill discusses his personal relationships with artists. He discusses how it's necessary to have empathy for successful artists. (32:03) -- "I think that's why I got real good relationships with everybody I produce. I'm honest with them." - Billy Sherril (32:14) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about producing for Lacy J. Dalton/first finding her. (34:00) -- Bob Allen asks about Billy Sherrill's producing for Tanya Tucker. (34:24) -- Billy Sherrill discusses the use of certain curse words in country music. Billy mentions Kris Kristofferson's lyrics impacting the acceptance of words such as 'body', 'damn', and 'hell'. (37:40) -- Billy Sherrill discusses his opinion that the public doesn't care about record producers.
